political_categories.name: Economy & Finance
political_categories.description: Policies affecting taxation, government spending, trade, business regulation, and employment.
political_categories.conservative_view: Free market capitalism with minimal government interference, lower taxes, reduced regulation, fiscal responsibility, and competition-driven growth.
political_categories.liberal_view: Government regulation to ensure fairness, progressive taxation, social safety nets, worker protections, and addressing income inequality.

subcategories.name: Taxes
subcategories.description: Income, corporate, and wealth tax policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Lower taxes stimulate economic growth, reduce government size, and allow individuals to keep more of their earnings.
subcategories.liberal_view: Progressive taxation funds public services, reduces inequality, and ensures wealthy pay fair share for societal benefits.

subcategories.name: Spending & Budget
subcategories.description: Government appropriations and fiscal priorities.
subcategories.conservative_view: Balanced budgets, reduced government spending, elimination of waste, and prioritizing essential functions only.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strategic government investment in infrastructure, education, healthcare, and social programs drives long-term prosperity.

subcategories.name: Trade
subcategories.description: Tariffs, free trade agreements, import/export policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Free trade increases prosperity through competition and efficiency, though some support protecting domestic industries.
subcategories.liberal_view: Trade policies should protect workers, environment, and human rights, not just maximize corporate profits.

subcategories.name: Business Regulation
subcategories.description: Antitrust, banking, financial sector regulation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Minimal regulation allows innovation and competition to drive efficiency and consumer benefits naturally.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong regulation prevents abuse, protects consumers, ensures fair competition, and prevents systemic risks.

subcategories.name: Labor & Employment
subcategories.description: Worker protections, unions, minimum wage laws.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market forces should determine wages and working conditions; excessive regulation hurts job creation and competitiveness.
subcategories.liberal_view: Worker protections, union rights, and living wages are essential for dignity, fairness, and economic stability.

subcategories.name: Monetary Policy
subcategories.description: Interest rates, inflation control, central bank policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Sound money, price stability, and limited central bank intervention protect savers and encourage investment.
subcategories.liberal_view: Monetary policy should support full employment, economic stimulus during downturns, and financial stability.

subcategories.name: Financial Markets
subcategories.description: Securities regulation, crypto, Wall Street oversight.
subcategories.conservative_view: Light-touch regulation promotes innovation, capital formation, and efficient allocation of resources through markets.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong oversight prevents fraud, systemic risk, and ensures markets serve broader economic goals, not just profits.

political_categories.name: Healthcare
political_categories.description: Healthcare coverage, costs, public health, and regulation.
political_categories.conservative_view: Market-based solutions, personal responsibility, choice in coverage, and competition to drive down costs and improve quality.
political_categories.liberal_view: Healthcare as a human right requiring universal access, government role in ensuring affordability, and public health prioritization.

subcategories.name: Coverage Models
subcategories.description: Universal healthcare vs private insurance systems.
subcategories.conservative_view: Private insurance and market competition provide better quality, choice, and efficiency than government-run systems.
subcategories.liberal_view: Universal healthcare ensures everyone gets care regardless of ability to pay, reducing costs through collective bargaining.

subcategories.name: Costs & Access
subcategories.description: Drug pricing, insurance affordability, billing transparency.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market competition and price transparency will naturally reduce costs; government price controls stifle innovation.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government intervention needed to control excessive pricing and ensure healthcare affordability for all.

subcategories.name: Public Health
subcategories.description: Pandemic response, vaccinations, community health programs.
subcategories.conservative_view: Individual choice and personal responsibility in health decisions; limited government mandates respect personal freedom.
subcategories.liberal_view: Collective action and government coordination necessary to protect public health and prevent disease outbreaks.

subcategories.name: Mental Health
subcategories.description: Funding, parity laws, suicide prevention.
subcategories.conservative_view: Community-based solutions, family support, and private sector innovation address mental health more effectively than government programs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government funding and insurance parity ensure mental health treatment is accessible and not stigmatized.

subcategories.name: Reproductive Health
subcategories.description: Abortion policy, contraception access, maternal care.
subcategories.conservative_view: Protection of unborn life, parental rights, religious freedom, and traditional family values guide reproductive policy.
subcategories.liberal_view: Women's bodily autonomy, reproductive choice, comprehensive sex education, and access to family planning services.

political_categories.name: Education
political_categories.description: Policies governing schools, universities, and student support.
political_categories.conservative_view: School choice, parental rights, local control, merit-based advancement, and traditional educational values and curriculum.
political_categories.liberal_view: Equitable public education funding, inclusive curriculum, teacher support, and addressing systemic educational inequalities.

subcategories.name: K-12 Education
subcategories.description: Funding, curriculum standards, teacher pay.
subcategories.conservative_view: Local control, parental choice in curriculum, merit pay for teachers, and emphasis on core academic subjects and discipline.
subcategories.liberal_view: Adequate public funding, professional teacher compensation, inclusive curriculum, and addressing achievement gaps.

subcategories.name: Higher Education
subcategories.description: Student loans, tuition, public university funding.
subcategories.conservative_view: Personal responsibility for education costs, reduced government subsidies that inflate tuition, and market-based solutions.
subcategories.liberal_view: Accessible higher education through public funding, loan forgiveness, and treating education as public investment.

subcategories.name: School Choice
subcategories.description: Charter schools, vouchers, homeschooling policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Competition improves education quality; parents should choose schools that align with their values and children's needs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Public schools need support, not diversion of funds; school choice can increase segregation and inequality.

subcategories.name: Education Equity
subcategories.description: Special education, closing achievement gaps.
subcategories.conservative_view: Equal opportunity through high standards for all; avoid lowering expectations in name of equity.
subcategories.liberal_view: Targeted resources and support needed to address historical disadvantages and ensure equal educational outcomes.

subcategories.name: STEM & Workforce Training
subcategories.description: Science, tech, engineering education, vocational programs.
subcategories.conservative_view: Industry partnerships and practical skills training prepare students for jobs; reduce emphasis on four-year college for all.
subcategories.liberal_view: Public investment in STEM education and job training programs ensure workforce competitiveness and worker mobility.

political_categories.name: Social Issues
political_categories.description: Civil rights, immigration, criminal justice, and family policy.
political_categories.conservative_view: Traditional values, law and order, national sovereignty, individual responsibility, and preservation of established social institutions.
political_categories.liberal_view: Social justice, equality, inclusive society, criminal justice reform, and protection of marginalized groups' rights.

subcategories.name: Civil Rights
subcategories.description: Anti-discrimination laws, voting rights protections.
subcategories.conservative_view: Equal treatment under law without special preferences; colorblind policies that don't consider race or identity.
subcategories.liberal_view: Active measures needed to combat systemic discrimination and ensure equal opportunities for marginalized groups.

subcategories.name: Immigration
subcategories.description: Border policy, pathways to citizenship, asylum.
subcategories.conservative_view: Secure borders, enforce existing laws, orderly legal immigration process, and protection of American workers and culture.
subcategories.liberal_view: Comprehensive immigration reform, humane treatment of migrants, pathway to citizenship, and embracing cultural diversity.

subcategories.name: Criminal Justice
subcategories.description: Police reform, sentencing, prison system funding.
subcategories.conservative_view: Law and order, support for police, tough sentencing for violent crimes, and personal accountability for criminal behavior.
subcategories.liberal_view: Criminal justice reform, addressing racial disparities, rehabilitation over incarceration, and police accountability.

subcategories.name: Family & Culture
subcategories.description: Marriage policy, gender and reproductive rights.
subcategories.conservative_view: Traditional family structures, parental rights, religious freedom, and biological reality in gender policy.
subcategories.liberal_view: Marriage equality, LGBTQ+ rights, gender identity recognition, and diverse family structures acceptance.

subcategories.name: Drug Policy
subcategories.description: Legalization, decriminalization, controlled substances.
subcategories.conservative_view: Maintaining drug prohibition to protect public health and safety, focus on enforcement and treatment.
subcategories.liberal_view: Drug decriminalization, harm reduction, treating addiction as health issue rather than criminal matter.

subcategories.name: Privacy & Civil Liberties
subcategories.description: Surveillance, individual rights, government overreach.
subcategories.conservative_view: Strong national security measures balanced with constitutional rights; law enforcement needs adequate tools.
subcategories.liberal_view: Robust privacy protections, limits on government surveillance, and strong civil liberties safeguards.

political_categories.name: Environment & Energy
political_categories.description: Natural resource policy, energy production, climate change response.
political_categories.conservative_view: Balanced approach prioritizing economic growth, energy independence, private property rights, and market-based environmental solutions.
political_categories.liberal_view: Aggressive climate action, renewable energy transition, environmental protection over short-term economic interests.

subcategories.name: Climate Policy
subcategories.description: Emissions limits, carbon pricing, green incentives.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market-based solutions, technological innovation, and avoiding economic disruption while addressing environmental concerns gradually.
subcategories.liberal_view: Urgent government action on climate change through regulation, carbon pricing, and rapid transition to clean energy.

subcategories.name: Energy Production
subcategories.description: Fossil fuels, nuclear power, renewable energy.
subcategories.conservative_view: All-of-the-above energy strategy including domestic fossil fuels for energy independence and economic benefits.
subcategories.liberal_view: Rapid transition to renewable energy sources, phase out fossil fuels, and government investment in clean energy.

subcategories.name: Conservation
subcategories.description: Public lands, wildlife, pollution control.
subcategories.conservative_view: Balanced use of natural resources for economic benefit while maintaining conservation; respect for private property rights.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong environmental protection, expansion of protected areas, and prioritizing conservation over resource extraction.

subcategories.name: Environmental Justice
subcategories.description: Equity in pollution exposure, protecting vulnerable communities.
subcategories.conservative_view: Economic opportunity and jobs can improve communities; avoid regulations that harm local economies.
subcategories.liberal_view: Address disproportionate environmental burdens on minority and low-income communities through targeted policies.

subcategories.name: Water Policy
subcategories.description: Clean water access, drought response, water rights.
subcategories.conservative_view: Respect existing water rights, market-based allocation systems, and local management of water resources.
subcategories.liberal_view: Ensure universal access to clean water, government role in conservation, and environmental flow protection.

political_categories.name: Technology & Innovation
political_categories.description: Regulation of digital platforms, privacy, and emerging tech.
political_categories.conservative_view: Light regulation to promote innovation, market competition, free speech protection, and American technological leadership.
political_categories.liberal_view: Strong regulation to protect privacy, prevent monopolization, ensure platform accountability, and address digital inequities.

subcategories.name: Data Privacy
subcategories.description: User data protection, surveillance limits.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market-based privacy solutions, individual choice in data sharing, minimal government interference in business models.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong data protection laws, user rights over personal information, limits on corporate data collection and use.

subcategories.name: Tech Regulation
subcategories.description: Big Tech antitrust, online content moderation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Protect free speech online, avoid censorship, let market competition address tech monopolies naturally.
subcategories.liberal_view: Break up tech monopolies, regulate platforms to prevent harm, ensure diverse voices and competition online.

subcategories.name: Emerging Tech
subcategories.description: AI, biotech, intellectual property rights.
subcategories.conservative_view: Light regulatory touch to maintain American innovation leadership, protect intellectual property rights and entrepreneurship.
subcategories.liberal_view: Proactive regulation to ensure AI safety, equitable access to benefits, and prevention of harmful applications.

subcategories.name: Cybersecurity
subcategories.description: Critical infrastructure protection, ransomware response.
subcategories.conservative_view: Public-private partnerships, strong cyber defenses, minimal regulation that could hamper security innovation.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government coordination of cybersecurity, regulation of critical infrastructure, international cooperation on cyber norms.

subcategories.name: Digital Speech & Misinformation
subcategories.description: Free speech vs moderation, disinformation campaigns.
subcategories.conservative_view: Protect free speech rights online, skeptical of content moderation that may silence legitimate viewpoints.
subcategories.liberal_view: Platform responsibility to combat misinformation while protecting legitimate speech and preventing harm.

political_categories.name: Infrastructure & Transportation
political_categories.description: Development of physical and digital infrastructure.
political_categories.conservative_view: Private sector efficiency, user fees for infrastructure, limited government role, focus on core infrastructure needs.
political_categories.liberal_view: Major public investment in infrastructure as economic stimulus, job creation, and ensuring equitable access.

subcategories.name: Transportation
subcategories.description: Roads, transit systems, aviation, maritime.
subcategories.conservative_view: User fees and private sector involvement in transportation, focus on roads and highways over mass transit.
subcategories.liberal_view: Public investment in mass transit, high-speed rail, and sustainable transportation options to reduce emissions.

subcategories.name: Digital Infrastructure
subcategories.description: Broadband expansion, rural connectivity.
subcategories.conservative_view: Private sector-led broadband expansion with minimal government interference, market competition drives access.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government investment needed to ensure universal broadband access, especially in underserved rural and urban areas.

subcategories.name: Housing & Urban Planning
subcategories.description: Affordable housing, zoning laws, urban renewal.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market-based housing solutions, reduce zoning restrictions, private sector development, homeownership promotion.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government role in ensuring affordable housing, tenant protections, addressing homelessness and housing discrimination.

subcategories.name: Public Works & Utilities
subcategories.description: Water systems, electricity grid, waste management.
subcategories.conservative_view: Private utility management where possible, user fees for services, efficient delivery through market mechanisms.
subcategories.liberal_view: Public utilities ensure universal access and affordability, government investment in modern, resilient infrastructure.

political_categories.name: Government & Institutional Reform
political_categories.description: Rules and systems shaping governance and elections.
political_categories.conservative_view: Limited government, constitutional originalism, federalism, election integrity, and maintaining traditional institutional structures.
political_categories.liberal_view: Democratic reforms, voting rights expansion, government accountability, and institutional changes to ensure fair representation.

subcategories.name: Electoral Law
subcategories.description: Voting rights, redistricting, election security.
subcategories.conservative_view: Election integrity through voter ID, accurate voter rolls, and preventing fraud while maintaining constitutional election processes.
subcategories.liberal_view: Voting rights expansion, automatic registration, easier ballot access, and preventing voter suppression.

subcategories.name: Campaign Finance
subcategories.description: Political donations, PACs, transparency rules.
subcategories.conservative_view: Political spending as free speech, minimal restrictions on contributions, market of ideas through unlimited political expression.
subcategories.liberal_view: Campaign finance reform to limit corporate influence, public campaign financing, and transparency in political donations.

subcategories.name: Judicial & Institutional Reform
subcategories.description: Court reform, ethics oversight, bureaucracy efficiency.
subcategories.conservative_view: Judicial restraint, originalist interpretation, respect for institutional traditions and constitutional limits on government power.
subcategories.liberal_view: Court reform to address politicization, strong ethics enforcement, and institutional changes for better representation.

subcategories.name: Transparency & Anti-Corruption
subcategories.description: Whistleblower protections, anti-bribery laws.
subcategories.conservative_view: Government transparency and accountability while protecting legitimate executive privilege and national security needs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong transparency laws, whistleblower protections, and robust anti-corruption measures to ensure public trust.

political_categories.name: Agriculture & Rural Issues
political_categories.description: Policies affecting farmers, food safety, and rural economies.
political_categories.conservative_view: Support for family farming, minimal regulation, market-based solutions, and preserving rural way of life and property rights.
political_categories.liberal_view: Sustainable agriculture, worker protections, environmental standards, and support for small farmers over agribusiness.

subcategories.name: Farm Policy
subcategories.description: Subsidies, crop insurance, agribusiness regulation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Support for family farmers through crop insurance and market-based programs while reducing regulatory burden.
subcategories.liberal_view: Farm subsidies should support sustainable practices, small farmers, and rural communities rather than large agribusiness.

subcategories.name: Food Safety
subcategories.description: Labeling, inspection, GMO policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Science-based food safety regulations, support for agricultural innovation including GMOs, minimal labeling requirements.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong food safety oversight, consumer right to know through labeling, precautionary approach to new food technologies.

subcategories.name: Rural Development
subcategories.description: Infrastructure, healthcare, broadband for rural areas.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market-based rural development, private sector solutions, maintain rural autonomy and traditional ways of life.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government investment needed to ensure rural areas have equal access to healthcare, broadband, and economic opportunities.

political_categories.name: Budget & Appropriations
political_categories.description: Overall fiscal planning, debt, and major spending bills.
political_categories.conservative_view: Fiscal responsibility, balanced budgets, debt reduction, limited government spending, and prioritizing essential functions only.
political_categories.liberal_view: Strategic government investment for economic growth, social programs, infrastructure, with less concern for short-term deficits.

subcategories.name: Debt & Deficit
subcategories.description: Debt ceiling, deficit reduction measures.
subcategories.conservative_view: Fiscal discipline requires debt reduction, spending cuts, and living within government means to avoid burden on future generations.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government debt acceptable for productive investments; focus on economic growth and revenue enhancement over austerity.

subcategories.name: Appropriations
subcategories.description: Omnibus spending bills, continuing resolutions.
subcategories.conservative_view: Streamlined government funding focused on core functions, line-item oversight to eliminate waste and unnecessary programs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Adequate funding for government services, social programs, and public investments even if requiring larger appropriations.

political_categories.name: Science & Space
political_categories.description: Policies advancing research, exploration, and innovation.
political_categories.conservative_view: Private sector innovation, market-driven research, space commercialization, and maintaining American technological leadership.
political_categories.liberal_view: Public investment in research and development, space exploration as public good, scientific research for societal benefit.

subcategories.name: Space Policy
subcategories.description: NASA programs, private space industry regulation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Private space industry leadership with minimal regulation, commercial space development, and national security space capabilities.
subcategories.liberal_view: NASA as public agency for exploration and science, regulation of commercial space to prevent conflicts and ensure safety.

subcategories.name: Research & Development
subcategories.description: Federal R&D funding, innovation initiatives.
subcategories.conservative_view: Private sector R&D more efficient, government role limited to basic research and national security applications.
subcategories.liberal_view: Government investment in R&D drives innovation, addresses market failures, and ensures research serves public interest.

political_categories.name: Disaster & Emergency Management
political_categories.description: Preparedness, response, and recovery from disasters.
political_categories.conservative_view: Local and state responsibility for disaster response, private sector efficiency, individual preparedness and responsibility.
political_categories.liberal_view: Federal coordination and resources necessary for effective disaster response, climate adaptation, and protecting vulnerable populations.

subcategories.name: Natural Disasters
subcategories.description: Hurricane, wildfire, earthquake response.
subcategories.conservative_view: State and local response with federal support, private sector involvement in recovery, personal responsibility for disaster preparedness.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong federal disaster response, climate change adaptation measures, and ensuring equitable recovery assistance.

subcategories.name: Emergency Preparedness
subcategories.description: FEMA programs, public warning systems.
subcategories.conservative_view: Efficient emergency management with state-led coordination, avoiding federal overreach while maintaining readiness.
subcategories.liberal_view: Well-funded federal emergency management, comprehensive preparedness programs, and coordination across all levels of government.

political_categories.name: Tribal & Indigenous Affairs
political_categories.description: Policy related to Native American tribes and sovereignty.
political_categories.conservative_view: Respect for tribal sovereignty within constitutional framework, economic development opportunities, and gradual integration approaches.
political_categories.liberal_view: Honor treaty obligations, support tribal self-determination, address historical injustices, and protect indigenous rights and culture.

subcategories.name: Tribal Sovereignty
subcategories.description: Self-governance, treaty rights.
subcategories.conservative_view: Balanced approach to tribal sovereignty respecting both tribal rights and federal/state authority within constitutional limits.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong tribal sovereignty, honoring treaty obligations, and supporting tribal self-determination and governance rights.

subcategories.name: Economic & Cultural Policy
subcategories.description: Resource rights, cultural preservation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Economic development opportunities for tribes through resource development and business partnerships while respecting property rights.
subcategories.liberal_view: Protect tribal cultural heritage and sacred sites, support traditional practices, and ensure equitable resource management.

political_categories.name: Government Role & Regulation
political_categories.description: The extent and nature of government involvement in society, economy, and individual lives.
political_categories.conservative_view: Limited government with minimal regulation allows free markets, individual liberty, and competition to produce optimal outcomes naturally.
political_categories.liberal_view: Active government intervention through regulation and programs protects vulnerable populations, ensures fairness, and addresses market failures.

subcategories.name: Regulatory Oversight
subcategories.description: Government rules and enforcement across industries.
subcategories.conservative_view: Excessive regulation stifles innovation, increases costs, and creates bureaucratic inefficiency that harms businesses and consumers.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong regulatory oversight prevents corporate abuse, protects public health and safety, and ensures accountability.

subcategories.name: Government Programs
subcategories.description: Social services, welfare, and public assistance initiatives.
subcategories.conservative_view: Government programs should be minimal and targeted, encouraging self-reliance and avoiding dependency on government support.
subcategories.liberal_view: Robust government programs provide essential safety nets, reduce inequality, and invest in human capital for long-term prosperity.

subcategories.name: Market Intervention
subcategories.description: Government involvement in economic activity and market regulation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Free markets self-correct and allocate resources efficiently; government intervention distorts natural market mechanisms.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strategic market intervention corrects failures, prevents monopolies, protects workers, and ensures equitable outcomes.

political_categories.name: Foreign Policy & National Security
political_categories.description: International relations, military engagement, and America's role in the world.
political_categories.conservative_view: Strong national defense with selective engagement prioritizing American interests; skepticism of international institutions limiting sovereignty.
political_categories.liberal_view: Multilateral cooperation through alliances and international institutions; diplomacy and humanitarian concerns alongside national interests.

subcategories.name: Military Intervention
subcategories.description: Use of military force, humanitarian intervention, foreign conflicts.
subcategories.conservative_view: Military force when necessary to protect vital national interests; avoid nation-building and prolonged foreign entanglements.
subcategories.liberal_view: Military intervention justified for humanitarian crises and supporting democracy; work through international coalitions when possible.

subcategories.name: International Alliances
subcategories.description: NATO, UN, multilateral agreements and partnerships.
subcategories.conservative_view: Alliances useful but shouldn't constrain American sovereignty or force costly commitments not in national interest.
subcategories.liberal_view: Strong alliances and international institutions multiply American influence and create framework for global cooperation.

subcategories.name: Global Leadership
subcategories.description: America's role as world leader vs focus on domestic priorities.
subcategories.conservative_view: America First approach prioritizing domestic needs; avoid being world's policeman while maintaining strong defense capabilities.
subcategories.liberal_view: Active global leadership serves American interests and values; retreat creates power vacuum filled by hostile actors.

subcategories.name: Foreign Aid
subcategories.description: Development assistance, humanitarian relief, democracy promotion.
subcategories.conservative_view: Foreign aid should be limited, tied to strategic interests, and not waste taxpayer money on ineffective programs abroad.
subcategories.liberal_view: Foreign aid advances humanitarian goals, promotes stability, builds alliances, and reflects American values of helping others.

political_categories.name: Federalism & Governance
political_categories.description: Balance of power between federal, state, and local governments.
political_categories.conservative_view: Power should be decentralized to states and localities; federal government limited to enumerated constitutional powers.
political_categories.liberal_view: Strong federal authority ensures nationwide standards, protects rights uniformly, and addresses problems beyond state capacity.

subcategories.name: Federal Authority
subcategories.description: Scope of federal government power over states.
subcategories.conservative_view: Federal overreach violates constitutional principles; states are laboratories of democracy best suited to local needs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Federal authority necessary to prevent race-to-the-bottom, protect minority rights, and address interstate issues.

subcategories.name: State Rights
subcategories.description: State sovereignty, nullification, resistance to federal mandates.
subcategories.conservative_view: States retain sovereignty on matters not delegated to federal government; can resist unconstitutional federal overreach.
subcategories.liberal_view: Supremacy Clause means federal law prevails; state rights historically used to defend discrimination and inequality.

subcategories.name: National Standards
subcategories.description: Uniform federal rules vs state-by-state variation.
subcategories.conservative_view: States should determine own policies on most issues; diversity of approaches allows experimentation and local tailoring.
subcategories.liberal_view: National standards ensure equal protection, prevent harmful state policies, and simplify compliance for interstate commerce.

political_categories.name: Civil Liberties vs Security
political_categories.description: Balance between individual privacy rights and collective security needs.
political_categories.conservative_view: Security and public safety require strong law enforcement with tools to prevent crime and terrorism, even if limiting some liberties.
political_categories.liberal_view: Civil liberties and privacy are fundamental rights that must be protected even when security concerns exist.

subcategories.name: Surveillance & Privacy
subcategories.description: Government surveillance programs, data collection, encryption.
subcategories.conservative_view: Law enforcement needs surveillance tools to prevent terrorism and serious crime; privacy yields to legitimate security needs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Mass surveillance violates Fourth Amendment; privacy protections essential to prevent government overreach and abuse.

subcategories.name: Law Enforcement Powers
subcategories.description: Police authority, search and seizure, detention powers.
subcategories.conservative_view: Police need strong powers and discretion to maintain order, deter crime, and respond effectively to threats.
subcategories.liberal_view: Unchecked police power leads to abuse; strong oversight, limits, and accountability protect individual rights.

subcategories.name: Due Process
subcategories.description: Legal protections for accused, habeas corpus, fair trials.
subcategories.conservative_view: Due process important but shouldn't be exploited to delay justice or release dangerous criminals on technicalities.
subcategories.liberal_view: Robust due process protections are cornerstone of free society; better to let guilty go free than imprison innocent.

political_categories.name: Populism vs Institutionalism
political_categories.description: Trust in established institutions and expertise vs populist skepticism.
political_categories.conservative_view: Elite institutions often disconnected from ordinary Americans; common sense and popular will should prevail over technocratic expertise.
political_categories.liberal_view: Democratic institutions, expertise, and established norms provide stability and informed policymaking essential for functioning society.

subcategories.name: Expert Authority
subcategories.description: Role of scientists, economists, and specialists in policymaking.
subcategories.conservative_view: Experts often wrong, biased, or disconnected from real-world impacts; regular citizens understand issues affecting their lives.
subcategories.liberal_view: Complex problems require specialized knowledge; experts provide evidence-based guidance essential for effective policy.

subcategories.name: Institutional Trust
subcategories.description: Faith in government agencies, courts, media, academia.
subcategories.conservative_view: Many institutions captured by liberal elites pursuing ideological agendas rather than serving public interest fairly.
subcategories.liberal_view: Institutions with checks and balances, professional norms, and expertise prevent chaos and protect democratic values.

subcategories.name: Popular Sovereignty
subcategories.description: Direct democracy, referendums, populist movements.
subcategories.conservative_view: Will of the people should directly shape policy; elites who dismiss popular opinion are antidemocratic and out of touch.
subcategories.liberal_view: Representative democracy with institutional safeguards protects minority rights and prevents tyranny of the majority.

political_categories.name: Trade & Globalization
political_categories.description: International trade policy, tariffs, and economic integration with global economy.
political_categories.conservative_view: Protect American workers and industries from unfair competition; prioritize national economic interests over global integration.
political_categories.liberal_view: Free trade creates prosperity through efficiency and cooperation; protectionism raises costs and invites retaliation.

subcategories.name: Trade Agreements
subcategories.description: Free trade deals, TPP, NAFTA/USMCA, multilateral agreements.
subcategories.conservative_view: Trade deals often benefit corporations over workers; negotiate bilateral deals prioritizing American manufacturing and jobs.
subcategories.liberal_view: Multilateral trade agreements increase prosperity, strengthen alliances, and create rules-based international economic order.

subcategories.name: Tariffs & Protection
subcategories.description: Import taxes, trade barriers, domestic industry protection.
subcategories.conservative_view: Strategic tariffs protect vital industries, counter unfair foreign practices, and prevent hollowing out of manufacturing base.
subcategories.liberal_view: Tariffs are taxes on consumers that raise prices, reduce efficiency, invite retaliation, and harm export industries.

subcategories.name: Supply Chains
subcategories.description: Reshoring, domestic manufacturing, strategic industries.
subcategories.conservative_view: Bring manufacturing home for national security, job creation, and reducing dependence on potentially hostile nations.
subcategories.liberal_view: Efficient global supply chains lower costs; targeted reshoring acceptable for critical goods but broad protectionism harmful.

subcategories.name: Global Integration
subcategories.description: Participation in global economy, international institutions.
subcategories.conservative_view: Economic nationalism prioritizes American workers; international institutions shouldn't override domestic economic policy.
subcategories.liberal_view: Interconnected global economy benefits all through specialization, innovation, and higher living standards worldwide.

political_categories.name: Corporate Power & Business
political_categories.description: Regulation of corporations, antitrust policy, and relationship between business and government.
political_categories.conservative_view: Business freedom and light regulation foster innovation, job creation, and economic growth; corporations drive prosperity.
political_categories.liberal_view: Large corporations require strong regulation to prevent abuse, ensure fair competition, and protect workers and consumers.

subcategories.name: Corporate Regulation
subcategories.description: Business rules, compliance requirements, corporate governance.
subcategories.conservative_view: Minimal regulation allows businesses to innovate and compete; excessive rules burden companies and reduce competitiveness.
subcategories.liberal_view: Corporate regulation prevents fraud, protects stakeholders, ensures accountability, and levels playing field for smaller businesses.

subcategories.name: Antitrust & Monopolies
subcategories.description: Breaking up large companies, merger review, market concentration.
subcategories.conservative_view: Market dominance through innovation is legitimate; aggressive antitrust harms successful companies and consumer benefits from scale.
subcategories.liberal_view: Concentrated corporate power stifles competition, harms consumers and workers; aggressive antitrust enforcement needed.

subcategories.name: Small Business Support
subcategories.description: Programs and policies favoring small vs large businesses.
subcategories.conservative_view: Reduce regulations and taxes benefiting all businesses; government shouldn't pick winners through small business preferences.
subcategories.liberal_view: Targeted support for small businesses and cooperatives counters advantages of large corporations and promotes local economies.

subcategories.name: Corporate Incentives
subcategories.description: Tax breaks, subsidies, government contracts for businesses.
subcategories.conservative_view: Business-friendly policies including targeted incentives attract investment, create jobs, and drive economic development.
subcategories.liberal_view: Corporate welfare and tax breaks rarely deliver promised benefits; level playing field better than subsidizing profitable companies.

political_categories.name: Tradition vs Progress
political_categories.description: Relationship between historical norms, religious values, and evolving social understanding.
political_categories.conservative_view: Traditional wisdom, religious values, and established norms provide moral foundation and social stability.
political_categories.liberal_view: Society should evolve based on reason, science, and expanding moral understanding; tradition shouldn't limit progress.

subcategories.name: Religious Influence
subcategories.description: Role of faith in public policy and government.
subcategories.conservative_view: Religious values provide moral framework for society; faith should inform policy and be accommodated in public life.
subcategories.liberal_view: Secular governance protects all faiths and none; religious beliefs are personal and shouldn't dictate policy for everyone.

subcategories.name: Historical Norms
subcategories.description: Preserving vs updating traditional institutions and practices.
subcategories.conservative_view: Time-tested institutions and practices contain accumulated wisdom; radical changes risk unraveling social fabric.
subcategories.liberal_view: Many historical norms perpetuated injustice; updating institutions to reflect current values is moral imperative.

subcategories.name: Science vs Faith
subcategories.description: Role of scientific evidence vs religious teaching in policy.
subcategories.conservative_view: Science and faith both provide truth; scientism dismisses valuable religious and traditional moral insights.
subcategories.liberal_view: Evidence-based, scientific approach to policy ensures effectiveness; faith is personal and shouldn't override empirical findings.

subcategories.name: Social Evolution
subcategories.description: Pace and direction of changing social values and norms.
subcategories.conservative_view: Social change should be gradual and respect what has worked; rapid transformation destabilizes society and families.
subcategories.liberal_view: Progress toward greater equality and justice should be embraced; clinging to outdated norms perpetuates harm.

political_categories.name: Individual vs Collective Responsibility
political_categories.description: Balance between personal responsibility and community/government solutions.
political_categories.conservative_view: Personal responsibility and voluntary cooperation produce better outcomes than government programs; individual liberty paramount.
political_categories.liberal_view: Collective action through government addresses systemic problems individual effort cannot solve; shared responsibility for common good.

subcategories.name: Welfare & Assistance
subcategories.description: Government support vs self-reliance for those in need.
subcategories.conservative_view: Welfare creates dependency; temporary help acceptable but long-term support undermines work ethic and personal responsibility.
subcategories.liberal_view: Social safety net provides dignity and opportunity; poverty often results from systemic issues beyond individual control.

subcategories.name: Healthcare Responsibility
subcategories.description: Individual vs collective responsibility for health coverage.
subcategories.conservative_view: Individuals should secure own healthcare through employment or private purchase; personal choices affect health outcomes.
subcategories.liberal_view: Healthcare is right requiring collective solution; medical needs shouldn't depend on employment or wealth.

subcategories.name: Community Solutions
subcategories.description: Role of voluntary associations, charity, vs government programs.
subcategories.conservative_view: Churches, charities, and community organizations address needs better than impersonal government bureaucracies.
subcategories.liberal_view: Voluntary charity insufficient for systemic problems; government programs ensure consistent, adequate support for all.

subcategories.name: Public Goods
subcategories.description: Government provision vs private alternatives for services.
subcategories.conservative_view: Privatize services where possible for efficiency; government should provide only truly public goods markets can't deliver.
subcategories.liberal_view: Some services too important to leave to profit motive; collective provision ensures universal access and quality.

political_categories.name: Democratic Governance
political_categories.description: Structure of democratic institutions, executive power, and government transparency.
political_categories.conservative_view: Strong executive leadership and decisive governance; respect for law and order; majoritarian rule within constitutional limits.
political_categories.liberal_view: Checks and balances, transparency, broad participation, free press; protect minority rights and democratic norms.

subcategories.name: Executive Power
subcategories.description: Presidential authority, emergency powers, executive orders.
subcategories.conservative_view: Strong executive necessary for decisive action and effective governance; commander-in-chief needs latitude to act.
subcategories.liberal_view: Executive power must be constrained by checks and balances; dangerous concentration of authority threatens democracy.

subcategories.name: Transparency & Press
subcategories.description: Government openness, freedom of press, whistleblowers.
subcategories.conservative_view: National security and effective governance sometimes require confidentiality; press often biased and destructive to institutions.
subcategories.liberal_view: Robust transparency, free press, and whistleblower protections are essential checks on government power and corruption.

subcategories.name: Voting & Elections
subcategories.description: Ballot access, voter ID, election security, electoral college.
subcategories.conservative_view: Election integrity through ID requirements and security measures; electoral college protects small states and prevents mob rule.
subcategories.liberal_view: Expand voting access and remove barriers; popular vote better reflects democratic will; security measures shouldn't suppress votes.

subcategories.name: Democratic Norms
subcategories.description: Respect for institutions, peaceful transfer of power, political discourse.
subcategories.conservative_view: Respect for law and order, traditional institutions, and authority; political correctness stifles legitimate discourse.
subcategories.liberal_view: Preserve democratic norms, accept election results, maintain civil discourse; dangerous rhetoric threatens democratic stability.

political_categories.name: Criminal Justice
political_categories.description: Approach to crime, punishment, policing, and the justice system.
political_categories.conservative_view: Tough on crime with strong law enforcement, serious consequences for criminals, prioritize public safety and victims' rights.
political_categories.liberal_view: Reform unjust system, address root causes of crime, emphasize rehabilitation, reduce mass incarceration.

subcategories.name: Sentencing & Punishment
subcategories.description: Prison terms, mandatory minimums, death penalty, three strikes laws.
subcategories.conservative_view: Serious crimes deserve serious punishment; strong sentences deter crime and incapacitate dangerous criminals.
subcategories.liberal_view: Mass incarceration ineffective and unjust; reduce sentences, eliminate mandatory minimums, abolish death penalty.

subcategories.name: Policing & Law Enforcement
subcategories.description: Police funding, tactics, accountability, community relations.
subcategories.conservative_view: Support and fund police; they face dangerous situations and deserve discretion; few bad apples don't represent profession.
subcategories.liberal_view: Reform policing through accountability, training, and oversight; address systemic racism and excessive force.

subcategories.name: Rehabilitation vs Punishment
subcategories.description: Prison programs, reentry support, restorative justice.
subcategories.conservative_view: Punishment and deterrence primary goals; rehabilitation programs fine but shouldn't diminish consequences for crime.
subcategories.liberal_view: Rehabilitation reduces recidivism and serves society better than purely punitive approach; invest in reentry programs.

subcategories.name: Drug Policy
subcategories.description: War on drugs, decriminalization, treatment vs incarceration.
subcategories.conservative_view: Drug use harms individuals and communities; maintain strong enforcement while offering treatment to those who seek it.
subcategories.liberal_view: Decriminalize drug use, treat addiction as health issue, end failed war on drugs that caused mass incarceration.

political_categories.name: Immigration Policy
political_categories.description: Comprehensive approach to immigration, asylum, and citizenship.
political_categories.conservative_view: Strict border enforcement, limited immigration levels, merit-based system, prioritize American workers and national security.
political_categories.liberal_view: Humane immigration system with pathways to citizenship, family reunification, refugee protection, and addressing root causes.

subcategories.name: Legal Immigration
subcategories.description: Visa categories, green cards, skill-based vs family-based.
subcategories.conservative_view: Merit-based system prioritizing skills needed by economy; reduce overall numbers and chain migration.
subcategories.liberal_view: Balanced system including family reunification; immigration benefits economy and reflects humanitarian values.

subcategories.name: Illegal Immigration
subcategories.description: Enforcement, penalties for unauthorized entry, deportation.
subcategories.conservative_view: Strong enforcement and consequences for illegal entry; amnesty rewards lawbreaking and encourages more illegal immigration.
subcategories.liberal_view: Provide pathway to legal status for long-term residents; enforcement should be humane and focus on serious criminals.

subcategories.name: Border Security
subcategories.description: Physical barriers, technology, Border Patrol resources.
subcategories.conservative_view: Secure border including physical barriers essential to sovereignty, security, and controlling illegal immigration.
subcategories.liberal_view: Smart border security using technology; walls ineffective, expensive, and symbolically harmful; address root causes of migration.

subcategories.name: Asylum & Refugees
subcategories.description: Refugee admissions, asylum claims, humanitarian protection.
subcategories.conservative_view: Tighten asylum rules to prevent abuse; limited refugee admissions prioritizing vetting and national security.
subcategories.liberal_view: Robust asylum system and generous refugee admissions fulfill humanitarian obligations and reflect American values.
